comments.body:
i really like the idea of the mansions having an owner, but i think the cane might be pretty overpowered, since, i believe, mansions aren't that rare.

what if it only had one of those spells / abilities?

or even no spells at all for owner type 1:

instead the mansion could be full of interesting traps, which, with the right tools and thinking, could be disarmed or snuck around. once in the inner chamber, there could be a book or smth telling the story of the wolf attack (i am new to minecraft; if this is not how books work just let me know lol), and you meet the owner, who asks you to trade him 10 wolf pelts or smth. for the first 10 you give him, he awards you with an iron sword (80%) or a steel sword (20%). maybe if the player has spent less than 28 days in game he'll give you 1-5 wooden swords instead. for every 10 pelts you give him after that, he trades for normal items (but he still only ever asks for wolf pelts)

but that's only if you want to keep with the theme of the wolf attack, which i think is a fun idea, but might be too specific and grow boring and old-hat for players quickly. perhaps a random hated mob could be rolled by the game for each new mansion (maybe these special mansions could be called hunting lodges?)

edit: i think that's too much loot. beginners play the game too. maybe cut the gems for owner 2 (magic user) down to less than 10, and no gems at all for owner 1. owner 1 = hunter villager (peaceful)
I like this idea, I hope it get implemented.

I love this idea...but speedrunners are going to hate this idea...Iron golems drop Iron and speedrunners need that stuff...but other than that, the idea is good...[If you play Minecraft dungeons, plz consider voting for my Ender Eclipse and Titan Guardian idea...This will make the end and ocean DLC more interesting and cool...but there is no image for them...if you are an artist, plz make an image for these two bosses]
1 blacksmith repair 1 golem per day
tell me about it
It might be better if the weapon smith can defend itself mainly because he sells weapons.
Yea when ever i come across one. They r slowly dying. They should be able to defend themselves. And be able to communicate
Makes sense

The armorer, toolsmith and weaponsmith all buy iron ingots from the player, so them healing golems with ingots is an interesting idea.

I don't think it'd be good for villagers to have "destructive" behaviours like slaughtering animals that could interfere with the player. But I would really, really like fishing villagers to "fish" (even if it's just an animation and they don't catch anything) rather than just stand on top of their barrel doing nothing.

They could have a behaviour like a farmer, where they seek water within a 4-block radius of their workstation, and perform the fishing animation if it's connected to a 3x3 area of water or greater.

I agree that they should be able breed, but not change to a normal villager. I think when they breed they should no longer despawn allowing you to keep them if they have a good trade like sand or packed/blue ice (especially sand, since it's the only renewable way to farm it). In doing so, you will earn an advancement (possibly called  "Stay a While") for breeding a wandering trader with a villager or another wandering trader. The child will always be a villager, even if both parents are wandering traders, because the point is they have settled down. Breeding two wandering traders could be another way of getting villagers if you don't have a village nearby or the ability to cure zombie villagers.

I had the idea that if there are not enough Villagers in a Village (AKA work stations available) Wandering Traders will become normal Villagers and take the job. Also, if there are too many Villagers in a Village (AKA all work stations are filled and there are still extra Villagers), then jobless Villagers and/or Nitwits will become Wandering Traders and leave the Village
Good idea
This would be an excellent way to mitigate the "mending books only come from swamp librarians" bull crap.
I really like that idea

How do they spawn?  Are they generated with their structures and don't spawn after (like Illagers)?  Do they spawn in their structure (like Wither Skeletons)?  Do they spawn generally like normal hostile mobs?

The one interesting idea for me is that they raise animals.  Does this mean that if you could catch and trap one in a pen with animals that they would breed them for you?

These are kind of just a combination of hard mode zombies, vindicators and the upcoming pillager. Maybe have what Mc rat said, neutral PNJ's. Maybe the barbarians could be replaced with a type of illager that have a reason for attacking the player. Maybe [PNJ name here] castles, with different types of illager-like enemies that only attack if you enter the fort. Or, for a more peaceful version, they could basically be the overwerlds zombie pigmen, allied together attacking any threats. An even more- Ok I'm gonna stop here because this idea deserves its own page.
Maybe the pillagers could pillage them to! Or they could ally with the pillagers.
They should spawn around the bell place. And should have there own spawn egg. It seems that naturally spawning them or promoting them via weapon is too hard.
I love this idea I picture them living near the shore with a little camp site

I really like the idea but i think most people think it would ruin the game.
If i may suggest, to keep things balanced, they should only spawn with stone weapons and leahter armor.This would not make them to powerful yet still useful, also once tamed their armor could be dyed any color, so players could defirentiate armys. They could be upgraded with new weapons amd armor at players cost. They should spawn in a small castle with some loot. The 3 behavior modes suggested are really good ideas. Only that when following they cannot teleport. If the player got on horse or boat and there is another nearby they could use it to follow player. The taming could be by giving them a random amount of emeralds.
I agree there should be a way to hire/own pillager outposts and their forces and patrols.
It would ruin the game, but we can make them a little weak and maybe the player can be their commander, so the player has a purpose in the action. But otherwise, it will be cool.
Maybe it could be a option in the create a world menu as royal archers and royal swordsman but a very good ifea

Nice idde. 

ok I also think that there should still be workers who mine, craft, cook and build
i think illagers(pillagers, evokers etc) should stay hostile and that it would ruin the game hiring them
long
I like it

My idea would make villagers be able to breed if they gain trading exp equivalent to going from rank zero to rank one. This idea here also would fix it making creeper explosions and endermen block moving null but making villagers unbreedable. as the only way to breed villagers is with food. But villagers don't pick up food with the mob greifing gamerule being false.  But since this idea basically fixes this issue, I'll just vote on this instead of clogging the site with similar post ideas.
Or they could make a separate PassiveMobGriefing gamerule
Great art
This is the perfect npc to add to minecraft... especially since Mojang is doing an update to the mountains that adds goats and "snowier snow", hopefully they look at this and decide to include this.
good, but call them hillbillies.

Mojang! Imagine 1 block tall, carrying normal sized pickaxes, adorable little guys/gals with attitude. They would be perfect candidate mobs for the Mountain update. They could ride around on goats and have awesome underground dwellings to loot at your own risk.
PS my concept art is not the best representation. I know you guys can do better ;)
This really addresses a mob addition and how they work vs the biome they're in, so we've changed the category.
I feel this adds to the Minecraft magic lore pretty well.
maybe end golems could have an effect that stops endmen from teleporting.

I think iron golems should be universal, with each dimension having its own additional smaller golem, like the snow golem.

The nether could have a magma block golem that throws fireballs, and the end could have a purpur golem that throws shulker bullets and ender pearls when a mob gets out of reach.
Great idea! It would be very nice to have more golem varieties. I also like the idea of mini golems, like in Minecraft Legends.

Completely agree the pathfinding for villagers in bedrock is poor and seriously limits creativity, try creating a village that looks good but does not mess up pathfinding of the villagers

 

i normally end up redesigning my village around poor villager AI

So I've created this huge underground breeding room with 40 beds, and I've created 2 very easy to access entrances to this room on the surface. These entrances on opposite ends of the room, and yet basically all the villagers are just standing in the middle of the surface and between the entrances and not going into the room because they're pathfinding AI is absolute garbage. Mojang, PLEASE improve the villagers AI on Bedrock Edition for the console.

I even tried making direct copies of the naturally generated houses and they still struggle (or fail) to enter them at night or to get to their jobs. I eventually gave up and had to knock out and entire wall for one villager to use his job block.

The villager pathfinding in bedrock is horrible, I'm trying to build a vertical village tower, and they cannot pathfind through the floors for the life of them. Please mojang I'm begging you, it is a miracle these villagers live before we come to their village.

Completely agree with this, I like to make towers to ocupy less space so my base isn't too wide, villagers and the concept of stairs are (apparently) totally incompatible. I tried with a simple one, only three floors and the roof with some space for farmer villagers and the bell, now they are looking to the roof in the floor bellow all the time just because they can't comprehend what stairs are.
Definetelly a thing that should be fixed soon because it breakes the game expirience pretty much for the bad.
Yes, we need this!

Either fix the pathfinding, or stop villagers from choosing beds and workstations that are on the far side of the village, instead of the beds and stations that are right next to them. This is so incredibly painful to work with.

Genuinely garbage pathfinding. So much so, you should just take away villager jobs. Just spawn them in and let them roam like a cow. There is 0 reasons I should lead a villager 100 blocks away from a workstation and have it run back to it. Even better, the villager didnt have anything. No bell, workstation, or bed to run to. Still ran right back to the same spot it shouldn't be in.

 - Version 1.21.82
Please do improve this. My game keeps crashing and freezing on Realms whenever I am in my village which has less than 40 villagers and no animal farms.
sounds cool. hopefully they'll add this.
the sheperd could do this it would be awsome!!
The idea is awesome dude.:))

I know I'm a bit late to reply, but there's a clear reason why this won't happen.

Feeding mobs causes them to breed. If Villager NPCs were autonomously feeding animals, the world would become over populated with mobs. It's the same reason no mob, including villagers eat autonomously, as they'll breed and flood the game with mobs.

While this may be the intention for you so you can abuse the Entity Cramming mechanic, you'd have no way to control it.
I think you're talking about Minecraft. This is the Minecraft Dungeons section. A raid would be cool in Minecraft Dungeons though.
it meant to be in the minecraft section
Please add I would love this it would be not only a dream come true it would solve my loneliness problems
Have them spawn in houses . But maybe not diamonds
How about they act like players and they follow the REAL player.
Instead of the player feeding the NPC, the NPC should just feed itself.
mine is just called eggs
I have always wanted this to be in the game.

This sounds good; I think itâ€™d be cool if only one Steve and one Alex (the characters themselves) appeared per world, and maybe be an option you can turn on for those who want to play as them or be alone (you could also enable/disable just one of them or both).

If they die, they can respawn; you would find them randomly while exploring and they act like the player would (Steve likely mining while Alex likely hunting/exploring but both would like all activities, so they could also both be doing the same things or building etc.), and they could appear together. If youâ€™re hostile to them (attack more than once with a weapon; they may attack if you hit once but stop when they realize youâ€™re not attacking), both would attack you even if you only got aggressive with one of them. You could get them to join you as friends, however, if you give them stuff like iron, diamonds, food, building blocks, etc. or maybe they could trade a little and you convince them that way.

You could also give them armor, and they may actually spawn with armor. If you kill them, they can respawn nearby and will remember what you did, making it hard to get them to trust you. You could give them food if theyâ€™re hungry or theyâ€™ll hunt/farm on their own and hopefully not die. They could fight alongside you and other cool stuff as buds with smart AI, and can do almost everything the player can do.
I would like NPC they are cool I think mojang can add a herobrine looking end bosss

Not just Alex and Steve but other characters that will follow you around like wolfs and you can have them stay and Guard or just follow you and help like a miner a combat person a wood cutter or just a villager because leading villagers back to your cave is hard it popular people like having a companion in Minecraft so why not make it possible maybe even hostile mobs but they would be a bit harder to befriend but yea I think this is a great idea
this is prefect! this means that I don't have to visit my farms and get recourse's each day so I don't have any sidetracks from adventuring.
gerat idea best one i read in a long time
I want to be a wolf
I want to be a alpha wolf
You could have them sell fire works and the higher the level of the villager the more fireworks he can sell you

That sounds like a phenomenal idea! If it were a new villager type, I could imagine that it could sell fireworks, bottles o' enchanting, turtle shells, and other eccentric items. Perhaps they would be a rare merchant type who's sizable house has an incredibly small chance of spawning in a village. I also imagine the merchant would be expensive to trade with, and would not have a workstation so a player could not assign another villager to be a merchant.
like this idea. why not add some special fireworks that can only trade from villagers?

We should have a fireworks villager that works at a fireworks table, which is a more advanced way to craft fireworks. Here's what the fireworks villager can trade:

Novice:

  • 24 paper for 1 emerald
  • 7 gunpowder for 1 emerald
  • 32 feathers for 1 emerald

Apprentice:

  • 16 of any random dye for 1 emerald
  • 24 gold nuggets for 1 emerald
  • 9 emeralds for 3 randomly colored random-lasting single-star firework rocket

Journeyman:

  • 4 phantom membranes for 1 emerald
  • 1 TNT for 1 emerald
  • 1 emerald for 1 glowstone dust

Expert: 

  • 12-32 emeralds for 1 crossbow with 1 randomly colored random-lasting 1-3 star firework rocket (price depends on amount of stars in the rocket)
  • 3 fire charges for 1 emerald
  • 1 diamond for 1 emerald

Master:

  • 8 emeralds for 1 randomly-colored firework star

It would be the "Pyrotechnic."
It would sell and trade things related with fireworks and TNT.
And its Work Station should be a Pyrotechnic Table: a new block that would make it easier to make fireworks.
Similar how the loom makes it easy to make banners.
genius
this would be very useful
Don't forget that in the trailer for MC Dungeons the antagonst is kicked out of the village for who He is,
Will the iron golems kill these baby illagers?
Uhohhotdog83, to answer your question, yes, but the baby Illagers will be pretty fast.

They should function like any other villager, but you have to keep the other villagers from kicking him out. the only villagers that should not try and kick him out are his parents, and if you "took care" of the villagers proceeding him no other villagers will kick him out. maybe he could be a mob that could try and win the villagers trust by protecting them with a random weapon so he can stay, or.... he goes nuts and kills all the villagers, then joins the nearest raid party.
I don't think iron golems should attack them, but they should act wary and stick around near them, like their suspicious.
If they have babies the baby would help protect villge
No no no...  Illagers are half-witch half-human. I dount that one of their parents are a witch or warlock.
This is great for lore, and would also be sorta heartbreaking to see in game

the skin colour is pigment gene thing.passed down from their ancestors.plus the reason their skin is also grey is because theyâ€™ve lived in cold regions.

 

also if you want villagers to have illager babies an illager must be with the villager to breed.

If they are enemies, that means minecraft IS an RPG game. Minecraft is a sandbox game, where you should be able to do anything, even join enemies.

I like the idea.
I really think this is a great idea!  I agree with Jhian Gabriel Muhi because minecraft really IS a sanbox game so you cannot be "good" or "evil" no matter what you do.

Maybe instead of throwing snowballs they would throw eggs and they naturally spawn at village farms. They should only attack mobs that eat the crops instead of attacking every hostile mob.
I love this idea and I love that they have a sword I think this would be a great addition to minecraft
Throw eggs AND have wooden sword

this ide sound awsome!! like the scarecrow would be drawn to farm land never brecking crops and scaring away rabbit, foxes, chickens, parrots, bats and some other mobs silverfish maybe and would not deal much damge maybe half a heart and only be made to sacre things from farm land

Iâ€™m commenting because I wasnâ€™t allowed to post my idea because this post exists.

â€œThe Hay Golemâ€ (Scarecrow)

1: Place any type of Fence* the fence determines your Golemâ€™s clothing
2: Place a Haybale on the Fence
3: Place a Carved Pumpkin/ Jack oâ€™Lantern on the Hay Bale

- â€œHay Golemsâ€ do not walk

- Using a Stick or any type of Hoe on the Golem equips the item to the Golem- The Hay Golem has sticks for arms, and the equipped item is â€œtiedâ€ to the ends of its arms to make its arms longer and give them scythes for hands. Each arm can be equipped with 1 Stick or Hoe.

- If a Hay Golem dies its drop chances are Pumpkin Seeds and Wheat, and the item it has equipped.

- Hay Golems have 7 Hearts, using Wheat restores 1 Heart

- Hay Golems can turn on their Block, and are animated.

- Zombies and Banshees are drawn to and attack Hay Golems, thinking they are injured Villagers.

- Hay Golems attack Zombies and Banshees, dealing damage based on their equipped Hoe/Stick.
If a Hay Golem has no weapon it is not able to attack Banshees, but Banshees will still attack the Golem. (It canâ€™t reach)

- Hay Golems will â€œtillâ€ all Dirt Block variants adjacent to it. The area of this increases by 1 Block if the Hay Golem is wielding a Stick, and increased by 2 Blocks if wielding a Hoe.

- â€œHaunted Hayrideâ€ if the Hay Golem (Scarecrow) becomes a thing: add the ability to place a Fence inside a Minecart, so the Hay Golems can ride on a track.
This would give respect to the animals and the trader.
Not gonna lie.... I hate the sound the llama's make so much that I usually attack his llamas on site.
A good idea to emphasize Wandering Trader's relationship with his pets.

It would be great. But smiths need something they can make of copper. Armor, tools, stuff.
Villagers have trades for iron and gold... why not copper too? It would certainly give it more use for players who don't care about metallic orange building blocks that turn blue over time.
I believe that stone mason's should buy copper because you can make building materials out of it. I'd say from 12 to 26 copper ingots the stone mason should buy for.

It would definitely be cool to see a new villager that trades mountain-related stuff, but I think adding a miner would be even more important than adding a mountaineer for this update. A goat herder would be pretty cool and might have more relevance to current planned features
